programme.title: European Poker Tour

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 4
programme.desc: At the European Poker Tours 20th anniversary celebrations, theres a throwback vibe in the Main Event. A player calling himself The Eliminator is holding court at the feature table. Expect banter and bluffs, as this old school character competes for the 1.5m first prize. (4/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 5
programme.desc: Survival is the name of the game, with just over 100 players remaining in the European Poker Tour Main Event. Most of the 9.5m prize pool is still up for grabs, and reigning champ Simon Wiciak and Monte-Carlo finalist Rania Nasreddine can both make EPT history. (5/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 6
programme.desc: Theres 1.5m for the winner of this special anniversary edition of the European Poker Tour. As Day 4 of the Main Event continues, the USAs Rania Nasreddine is put through the wringer and a new generation of poker talent starts to make its mark. (6/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 7
programme.desc: Only 40 players remain in the European Poker Tour Main Event, including reigning champion Simon Wiciak. Can the French pro go back-to-back? The competition is tough: chip leader Stephen Song and Monte-Carlo finalist Rania Nasreddine are also eyeing the 1.5m top prize. (7/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 8
programme.desc: In the late stages of this European Poker Tour Main Event, mistakes are starting to creep in. But theres no margin for error, with millions still on the line. Among the final 23 are American pro Stephen Song and former EPT finalist Rania Nasreddine. (8/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 9
programme.desc: All eyes are on the USAs Rania Nasreddine, as she tries to make back-to-back European Poker Tour final tables. Brazilian pro Fabiano Kovalski is another previous EPT finalist looking for a second chance at victory. The top prize in this tournament is 1.5m. (9/11)

programme.desc: Nine remain in the Main Event. Two will make history.

The men insinuate themselves with Chaves in preparation for the robbery, but when Will (Joel McCrea) falls in love with a widow (Arlene Dahl) traveling with Chaves, the three men must decide whether to continue the plan.

programme.title: Wichita
programme.desc: After a group of drunken trail riders runs amok, Mayor Andrew Hope (Carl Benton Reid) of Wichita, Kan., recruits the intrepid Wyatt Earp (Joel McCrea) to end lawlessness. Armed and ready for anything, the new marshal decides he will end gun violence simply by banning guns. Soon Earp must face crooked rancher Clint Wallace (Walter Sande) and whiskey slinger Doc Black (Edgar Buchanan), vicious locals who like Wichita exactly as it is and don't take kindly to being told what to do.

programme.title: The Moonlighter
programme.desc: Wes Anderson (Fred MacMurray) is caught cattle rustling and promptly jailed. The public is outraged, but, since Wes always worked at night, they don't know what he looks like. Still, they break into the prison and lynch a hobo they think is Wes, while the actual culprit sneaks off to see his old flame, Rela (Barbara Stanwyck), who has recently taken up with his straitlaced brother, Tom (William Ching). But Tom is envious of his outlaw brother, and he decides to join Wes in a life of crime.

programme.title: Trooper Hook
programme.desc: Wanted for killing a squadron of soldiers, Apache Chief Nanchez (Rudolfo Acosta) is finally captured by Sgt. Clovis Hook (Joel McCrea), who discovers among Nanchez's prisoners Cora Sutliff (Barbara Stanwyck), who had been missing for several years. Sutliff has not only fully integrated into the Apache way of life, she also has a son with Nanchez. Now Hook wants to transport her back to her old way of life, but Nanchez isn't willing to let his son be taken from him.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Roy and Dale question the identity of a man claiming to be a friend of the local minister.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: The area is plagued by a rash of stagecoach robberies by a gang of outlaws

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: When students become lawmen for a day, the new "sheriff's" uncle takes advantage.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Roy and Dale are caught between feuding cattlemen and homesteaders.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Assigned to guard the workers building Arizona's first telegraph line, Hoppy learns that a supposedly retired man who owns several stores will lose a fortune if the line is completed, and uses wiretapping to foil a sabotage scheme.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy uses a health tonic to prove the innocence of a convicted murderer and the guilt of the real killer.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: When Hoppy and Red try to conduct an honest election in outlaw territory, the outlaws retaliate by getting Hoppy's nephew into trouble.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy risks death to convince the family and friends of vanished rancher Tom Murdock that his ghost has not returned from the dead to haunt them.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: When beautiful Lola Montez arrives, it causes quite a stir in San Francisco.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: The Bandanna Gang is causing a disturbance, so Matt consents to escort some settlers to San Francisco.

programme.title: Great Day in the Morning
programme.desc: In Denver before the outbreak of the Civil War, North Carolina native Owen Pentecost (Robert Stack) tricks saloon owner Jumbo Means (Raymond Burr) into losing everything he owns -- including some valuable mining claims -- in a card game. As headstrong dressmaker Ann (Virginia Mayo) and bartender Boston (Ruth Roman) spar over Owen's affections, his fellow Southerners begin assembling their gold to fund the Confederate Army, as the town's Northerners form their own militia and prepare for war.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Marshal Wayne suspects fraud when a couple start selling stock in a gold mine.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Matt gets sworn in as a U.S. marshal when stage holdups occur.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: The Prince of Thieves executes a daring robbery in San Francisco.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Matt goes sinister Hangtown due to a dying man's last request.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Beautiful Elizabeth Blythe comes from New York to Tombstone to write a story about the town too tough to die; her nose for news promptly leads her into mortal danger when she is captured by outlaw Ed Chandler.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Released from prison together, Jake Conroy and Hobe Jones scheme to rob a rich mine owner; with the cash in their control, the thieves ride hard from Mexico with Sheriff Clay Hollister and Editor Harris Claibourne in pursuit.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas comes to the rescue when escaped convicts hold up the general store in North Fork and take Marshall Torrance hostage.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Young Mark manages to capture a hawk but falls into danger with a rattlesnake. A stranger comes to his rescue and Mark invites the man home, unaware that he is on the run from the law.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas takes in an orphaned teen being raised by his abusive uncle after there is trouble at the school.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The McCains try to be tolerant of their embittered neighbor Abel MacDonald, but they decide he's gone too far when he won't allow his injured boy to get medical treatment.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Christmas in New Orleans may not be particularly festive in the Derringer household this year. Nancy learns his Uncle, a government engraver, has been murdered & the plates for the new hundred-dollar bill has disappeared. While Yancy searches for the murderer, his old hound-dog Dixie shows up at his family home proving to be the only one who can lead Yancy to where the family treasure is buried.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy learns that there are two men impersonating him and Pahoo, running wild around New Orleans, and committing crimes for which he and Pahoo are being charged. A vengeance-seeking woman is convinced these imposters have stolen her family fortune, leaving it up to Yancy and Pahoo to clear their names and track down the real criminals.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: When a mine's shares go up for sale, Bat uncovers a scheme to salt the mine and raise its value.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: After witnessing a gunfight, Bat becomes involved with embezzlers, killers and a dog that steals.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Working with the railroad, Bill turns down a bribe from a landowner to detour the track through his town, the man then forces a doctor to quarantine the railroad workers.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill finds an old prospector almost dead from thirst, and brings him in to the railroad workers camp.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Outlaw Sam Morley falls in love with a young woman who has a serious illness and asks Lucas to turn him in for the reward and use the money to pay for her medical care.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas welcomes his old friend Tom Birch, who once saved his life, unaware that the man is now a bank robber on the run with his gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A Chinese man and his son fight prejudice as they try to open a laundry in North Fork.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark decide to enter a local turkey shoot to raise money to buy a ranch.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Cattle baron Oat Jackford orders his two cowboys to run Lucas McCain and his son off their ranch.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Mark gets caught on a mountain ledge, a young outlaw risks his life to rescue him and breaks his leg doing so.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The notorious Shelton rides into the town of North Fork to take revenge on an elderly Marshal who is now crippled and working for Lucas McCain.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A vengeful judge who believes Lucas was responsible for his son's death, kidnaps Mark McCain to revenge himself on Lucas.

programme.desc: When Mark tries to play Cupid between Lucas and a pretty young stranger who arrives in North Fork, the girl's two older brothers accuse him of trifling with her affections and challenge him to fight them both.

programme.desc: An arch-criminal has been run out of New Orleans and is passing through North Fork. Spotting the McCain ranch, he tells McCain he wants to buy it.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas gets in trouble when he accuses the foreman of a neighboring ranch of rustling some of his cattle.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark are returning from a big cattle sale when the stage is robbed by three outlaws. Lucas, desperate to recover the money that was stolen, is determined to pursue the outlaws.

programme.desc: A famous gunfighter marries and decides to retire. He and his wife settle down in North Fork and open a store, but three outlaws arrive in town looking to best him in a gunfight.

programme.desc: Josh brings in outlaw Carlos Domingo, but he has to be released when the witness against him is killed. Josh concocts a surprise witness to testify against the notorious killer - his own mother.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's dividing his Pulmonaria and gives advice on frost-protection, Joe visits a tropical oasis outside Bristol, and Carol looks at Rowans from around the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the arrival of October, it is time to start thinking about getting some onions and garlic in the ground, and Monty Don shares his secrets on how to get a successful crop. Elsewhere, Carol Klein takes first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for a day out in Devon. They are on the hunt for some seasonal inspiration for their new garden and what better place to look than RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol is looking at one of the gems of early spring; the crocus, Joe visits a bog garden in west Wales, and Rachel visits a fabulous rose garden with over 2500 different varieties.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol looks at the spring delight that is the cyclamen, Joe visits a gardener taking on the challenges of gardening on the windswept Cornish coastline, and Monty tackles the problem of box blight.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives his pond a spring clean, Carol helps a family in Gloucestershire with their first garden, and Joe visits a gardener in Northumberland who copes with extremes of temperature.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein admires the true harbinger of spring, the daffodil. Also, a visit to dahlia enthusiast Darren Everest on his allotment in Kent, and Monty Don pots up his dahlia tubers, and offers tips for getting the best results later in the year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is giving his ornamental grasses an overhaul. He's got tips on how to lift and divide ones that have grown too large. Meanwhile, Rachel visits the stunning Trebah Garden in Cornwall to revel in their glorious collection of hydrangeas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don finishes rejuvenating his dry garden, a sun baked corner of the garden that had become over-run by thuggish plants, and Carol Klein is in the rather exotic setting of Abbotsbury Subtropical Gardens in Dorset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has suggestions for beautiful climbers that thrive in shady spots and gets on with planting up his vegetable garden, while Carol Klein returns to help first time gardeners, Dan and Dominique.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is with eminent plantsman Keith Wiley, at his garden in Devon, celebrating the exquisite dog's tooth violet. At Longmeadow, Monty Don cracks on with some timely tasks and makes a start on planting up a yew hedge.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is at home sharing his love of ornamental grasses, tackling the problem of building a patio on a slope and giving some inspiration on what to plant at the base of a wall. In Margate, the team visit a man who has come up with a unique way of using a shed roof to grow vegetables, and they travel to Swansea to meet inspirational gardener Sue Kent, who shows how she has designed her garden to enable her to garden successfully despite her upper limb difference.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is preparing for spring colour as well as harvesting pumpkins and squashes. programme.title: Gardeners' World

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Ismael Garcia was just a young soldier when a tragic incident in Afghanistan changed his life forever. He was left wounded and scarred, but the hardest part came after he returned home. Hunting had always been his escape. But after war, everything felt different until he picked up a bow.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade shows us around some of his investment properties, and Ryan kills a nice bull elk in New Mexico.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade takes us around the hometown hunting grounds and shows us some of the last bits of preparation for the season. An old buck thats been showing up on camera at night decides to daylight and pays the price.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike and Capt. Glenn Taylor fish their home waters and pay tribute to dear friend Capt. Billy Nobles.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt Mike meets up with Leiza Fitzgerald and Jimmy Huddleston for a star tournament redfish tag mission.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Long time friends Mike and Danny find a hot top water bite.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon takes outdoorsman Zac Yarbrough to look for blackfin tuna and then out deep for swordfish. They are joined by Styles Haury for some epic offshore action.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Renowned Kiteboarder Mike Walsh goes out on a windy day with Brandon to see what they can catch around the iconic lighthouses of the middle Keys.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Get to know one extraordinary person who works on the show as we go fishing with underwater cameraman and boat captain himself, Garrett Stephens.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Jared Dieguz has been fishing all his life and now that he's running his own charter business, finding a day to "scout" the sea is more important than ever.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: On a crisp Iowa November morning, everything comes together as Drake Lamb with Midwest Whitetail grunts in a massive 8-point buck that he encountered before with the WoodHaven Midwest Grunter. This is one hunt you dont want to miss!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stopsgetting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Callto turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: U.S. Marines combat correspondent Ken Plant tells of being captured and tortured as a POW.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Bow season is finally here and the boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma. Randy is chasing a buck he named "The Camp Buck" because of how close the buck is to camp. If Randy can get it done this will be his biggest buck to date in Oklahoma.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling The River Farm they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt struggles with freezing Nebraska temperatures on a whitetail rut hunt in the Sandhills.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Willi and Chris have hunted NM for years with some success each year. This year they include two new friends, Nick Ventura and his dad. They receive rain like they never had before and when they finally make it out to hunt, Willi is hoping to connect.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Willi spends 8 days chasing a few bucks, but has sights set on High Beam. After a few encounters and one on his last morning, he hopes for last minute success on his last afternoon.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: October is here. We start out in Nebraska, head to Kansas and end up in Georgia. Many people have been impacted by the recent hurricanes. To help those in need we are hunting does and will donate as much venison as we possibly can to the victims.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan and Michael Pitts try to keep the new season streak going. Things get real in a hurry when Pitts encounter doesnt go as planned.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Greg Camp heads back to Nebraska for the third year in a row hoping to put his bow tag on a giant 10 Pointer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer seasons past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson closes out the half way point on the South America Waterfowl Slam. On just the third day of the hunt, he is able to take a Chilean Wigeon and a Rosy Billed Pochard which make species number 9 and 10 of the 20 on his list. Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Over the years we have been able to hunt with a lot of amazing people. This episode takes us to Las Palmas ranch to hunt with Payton Angelle. Payton was awarded this hunt from the amazing people over at Sky High for kids.
These hunters know the key to taking giant whitetails consistently is all about being in the right place at the right time. Brady Snyder hunts down a giant 200 buck in Iowa from 2023.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: What do you do when you fish for a living and get a day off? You go fishing! With weather on the forecast and a last minute cancelation, Rush calls long time friend Capt. Tony "Key Limey" Murphy to see what will bite before the cold front hits Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: It might be cold and windy, but if you have trust in your guide the result could be an epic day of fishing! Rush steps up to the challenge and puts Ali on an incredible bite of mutton snapper while also checking another species off of Ali's bucket list!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As season 8 comes to a close, Ali and Rush reflect on some of the more memorable moments on the water. From the Florida Keys to San Diego, Guatemala, and the Bahamas, the show has taken us on quite the adventures with more to come!
These hunters know the key to taking giant whitetails consistently is all about being in the right place at the right time. Brady Snyder hunts down a giant 200 buck in Iowa from 2023.
If you hunt big whitetails this is a must see! Follow Adam Hays and Lee Lakosky as they hunt for multiple giants and learn some tactics for harvesting monster whitetails!

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Blair fishes the flats of the Florida Space Coast with Capt. Jon Lulay.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Blair and Capt Chris Broome head to the back country of Marco Island to catch fish. Who knows what they'll catch.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team follows the project of a detailed retrofitting of a Bertram upgrading from one motor to twin engines with the help of an Armstrong Bracket. The team then heads to Boatwrench Inc. to rebuild the carburetor for the Glastron project.

programme.title: Destination Dive

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week our team visits the G2 Ranch along with life time TTHA member Owen West. Owen has been a member and volunteer for Texas Trophy Hunters for 46 years and was invited to share camp with us. It was a hunt he never dreamed would happen in his lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: The China Syndrome
programme.desc: A news reporter (Jane Fonda) and her cameraman (Michael Douglas) are unintentional witnesses to a SCRAM incident, an emergency core shutdown procedure at a nuclear power plant in California. The crew prevents a catastrophe, but the plant supervisor (Jack Lemmon) begins to suspect the plant is in violation of safety standards, and tries desperately to bring it to the attention of the public, fearing that another SCRAM incident will produce an atomic disaster.

programme.title: The Deal
programme.desc: After losing her husband and daughter in a terrible fire, an American woman living in Spain investigates a dangerous mystery surrounding their deaths.

programme.title: First Daughter

programme.title: First Target

programme.title: Cowboy Up
programme.desc: Follow the tumultuous life of two brothers, Ely, a rising rodeo star, and Hank, a rodeo clown, as they make their way through the bull riding circuit.

programme.title: Pal Joey
programme.desc: Charming musical featuring the love triangle between a lovable but mischievous man and the two women who could change his life, for love or money.

programme.title: Bad for Each Other
programme.desc: Wooed by a Pittsburgh socialite, an idealistic doctor from a mining town is torn between helping his community and lucrative work at an elite clinic.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Girl
programme.desc: Fired from her job as a switchboard operator, a daffy young woman tries her hand at door-to-door cosmetics sales only to get mixed up in a murder rap.

programme.title: Let's Do It Again!
programme.desc: In this 1953 musical remake of The Awful Truth, a recently-divorced couple try every way to make each other jealous.

programme.title: The War Lover
programme.desc: In England during World War II, a pair of bomber pilots fall for the same woman but only one will make it through the conflict to ask for her hand.

programme.title: Murderer's Row
programme.desc: Secret agent Matt Helm must rescue the kidnapped inventor of an ultra-destructive "helio beam" capable of destroying Washington, D.C.

programme.title: We Were Strangers
programme.desc: When her brother is murdered, China Valdez (Jennifer Jones) swears revenge on the corrupt Cuban government he had been protesting. She joins the resistance led by Tony (John Garfield), an American with a plan that promises devastating results to their enemies. First they'll kill a government official, then plant a bomb at the funeral, which will wipe out the dead man's associates when it explodes. All they need to do is to dig an underground tunnel from China's house to the cemetery next door.

programme.title: Love Has Many Faces
programme.desc: Wealthy Kit Jordan (Lana Turner) and her dissolute husband, Pete (Cliff Robertson), are in Acapulco, Mexico, when a corpse washes onto the beach. The deceased was a lover of Kit's and a friend of Pete's, so the police question the Jordans. Then the dead man's girlfriend (Stefanie Powers) arrives, and she and Pete have an affair. Luckily, Kit has her choice of men to distract her. There is gigolo Hank (Hugh O'Brian), bullfighter Julian (Carlos Montalban) and, when in a pinch, even her husband.

programme.title: No Sad Songs for Me
programme.desc: Upon being diagnosed with terminal cancer, selfless suburban housewife Mary Scott (Margaret Sullavan) makes the ultimate sacrifice: she decides to keep the unpleasant news from her husband, Brad (Wendell Corey), and daughter, Polly, to avoid devastating her loved ones. Instead, Mary encourages Brad's affair with a co-worker (Viveca Lindfors), and even grooms the other woman to take her place. But as Mary's illness progresses, keeping it a secret presents a considerable challenge.

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: A mute boy who spends his days roaming the English countryside starts coming out of his shell when he befriends a wild pony and a retired colonel.

programme.title: The Guilt of Janet Ames
programme.desc: War widow Janet Ames (Rosalind Russell) is struck by a car, and later her doctors suspect she may have been attempting suicide. A note in her pocket lists five men whom her husband died saving in battle, and they are contacted to help Janet's recovery. The first man on the list, jaded reporter Smitty Cobb (Melvyn Douglas), is offended when Janet says she hopes to prove her husband died in vain to save five worthless men, and offers to "introduce" Janet to each of the men through hypnotism.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: Convinced theyre the first men on the moon, three astronauts discover evidence of a lunar landing decades earlier and track down its sole survivor.

programme.title: American Madness
programme.desc: During the Depression, the bank owned by generous Dickson (Walter Huston) is barely staying afloat, and things get worse when $100,000 is lifted from the vault. Fingers are pointed at reformed crook Matt (Pat O'Brien), who got a job and a fresh start from Dickson. The innocent Matt can clear his name by admitting that on the night of the robbery he was breaking up a tryst between Dickson's wife and another teller. But this revelation may crush Dickson, and Matt's conscience plays tug-of-war.

programme.title: Under the Yum-Yum Tree
programme.desc: The machinations of a lusty landlord threaten the bliss of a couple trying to determine their character compatibility by living together platonically.

programme.title: Operation Mad Ball
programme.desc: A group of enlisted men, led by Private Hogan, are tasked with planning a dance party, while trying to keep it a secret from a busy-body officer.

programme.title: Lightning Guns
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) investigates the murder of a banker who was about to loan a rancher some money for a controversial dam project.

programme.title: Good Day for a Hanging
programme.desc: When the local sheriff is killed after a bank robbery, ex-lawman Ben Cutler (Fred MacMurray) collars the apparent killer, Eddie Campbell (Robert Vaughn). Because of his background as a local youth who spent time living with the Cutlers, Eddie gets the benefit of the doubt from Ben's daughter and his wife-to-be, Ruth (Margaret Hayes). Ben is firm in his belief that Eddie is guilty, and as the matter is debated in a divisive court battle, it will soon become clear whether or not he's right.

programme.title: Edge of Eternity
programme.desc: Widowed Les Martin (Cornel Wilde) is an ex-detective haunted by a case he left behind in Denver. Now, Martin is the deputy sheriff of a small Arizona town with nothing to do but pull over beautiful local socialite Janice Kendon (Victoria Shaw) for occasional speeding -- until a mysterious murder at a nearby ghost town requires him to put his old skills to use once again. With the help of Sheriff Edwards (Edgar Buchanan) and Kendon, Martin must unravel a murderous plot involving stolen gold.

programme.title: Apache Ambush
programme.desc: On a cattle drive to Kansas after the Civil War, an ex-Union soldier comes up against Apache and Confederate renegades.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: Bart and sidekick Sam arrive in Sundown on the wedding day of town boss Tate Kimbrough, whom Bart blames for his wife's death years earlier.

programme.title: Seminole Uprising
programme.desc: An Army lieutenant (George Montgomery) is ordered to go after Florida Indians in Texas.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to prison but allows his outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: The victims must outsmart their cruel captors after an outlaw, and his gang kidnap an heiress, her nervous husband, and a rancher.

programme.desc: A Swedish settler (David Brian) starts a war when he tries to drive Dakotas off their Wyoming reservation.

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fiance, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.desc: Pastry chef Chrissie Larkton's mill has been in her family for centuries. She restored it and turned it into a thriving online business, but the popularity has overshadowed Lower Blissingham, and many of the villagers are not happy about it.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Elverton-Cum-Latterly battle in the Dominoes Competition that dates back decades, but when the event occurs the same night as a drag queen fundraiser for a terminally ill teenager, it results in a deadly clash of cultures.

programme.title: Super Sleuths - Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Murders team opens up about their experience of working on the popular crime drama and provides insight into the overall process of bringing it to the small screen.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Mysterious lights are seen in the sky over famous UFO hot-spot Cooper Hill. When a local forest-ranger suffers a strange death the visiting UFO spotters are convinced aliens are responsible. DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson unearth suspicions, betrayals and long-buried secrets in their search for the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An international cycling competition comes to the Midsomer village of Burwood Mantle. When the race leader is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson find themselves drawn into a ruthlessly competitive world of blackmail, bribery and bloodshed where winning comes at any cost.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Art comes to the picturesque Midsomer village of Angel's Rise with the opening of a new Sculpture Park. But when its launch is marred by murder, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to get creative to crack a case where art imitates death, and everything has a deeper meaning.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The discovery of a Saint's bones at an archaeological dig causes a stir in the village of Midsomer Cicely. But when the leader of the dig is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson soon realise that it's not only skeletons that have been long buried in the hallowed ground.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual fair and the daredevil riders of the Wall of Death come to Midsomer village Whitcombe Mallet. When the owner of an equestrian centre is trampled by his horse DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to unravel a complex feud from the past, where nothing is what it seems...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Peter and Caroline Cave are house-hunting in Midsomer Newton. Shortly before leaving their hotel they mention they haven't been able to find what they're looking for; "something old and derelict that they can do up." Anne Merrick tells them about Winyard, a tumbledown cottage in the woods, might be for sale. At the estate agents they are told the house is not yet available for viewing. Later that evening they find the house on their own. However, Caroline has read up on the cottage's haunted reputation and only reluctantly explores it with Peter. The next morning they are found strangled in their own car. DCI Barnaby starts the investigation with the help of PC Ben Jones and they come across the world of estate agents, identical twins, ghosts, piano wire, and more before another body turns up.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers of Midsomer Barton are all set to celebrate Oak Apple Week, especially as the carnival queen event is set to return after an eight year absence. Yet the body of the mother of a deceased, one-time carnival queen, found in a stream, looks set to spoil things, as Barnaby and Jones find themselves digging up the past. From familiar faces, to drunken boasts and hidden obessions, it slowly becomes clear that the mother's daughter might be the key to solving the murder, when more deaths follow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Wealthy, eccentric and obese aristocrat Freddy Butler drops dead, shortly after gathering all three of his wives at Haddington Hall to make an announcement. Although George Bullard is adamant his death is from natural causes, the case is far from simple when Freddy's solicitor is deliberately killed in a house fire shortly afterwards and Freddy's will goes missing. Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating the extended Butler family, uncovering hidden secrets, illegitimate children and elusive treasure in the process.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Martin Barrett, a local council clerk living in Midsomer Worthy, is murdered during the night by shotgun, prompting Barnaby and Jones to find a motive for his murder. When they discover that Barrett was an expert blackmailer, his victims become prime suspects for his death - from a local pub landlord, a cleaner, a prominent member of the police board, to a former marine geologist. As they investigate, finding themselves drawn to the seaside, they slowly uncover deception, theft, attempted blackmail and hatred.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe's two-yarder plan goes further off track when one crew member defects to the other team; Big Gun races their tightest deadline yet; Joe and the new guy get into it; an accident could take S&S out of the Log-Off for good.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: At Rygaard, a crew shakeup leaves everyone scrambling; S&S suffers a blow; Buck and Swilley get unexpected help from James; Papac takes to the open seas for a fishing trip; Big Gun brings in a new yarder operator.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jimmy Smith braves the depths of the Suwannee River; Shelby takes on a log that flipped his winch last season; the boys of Siderius play fast and loose; Rygaard pushes their yarder to the brink of disaster.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe's two yarder sides are reunited; the alliance between team Buck and James Smith comes to a bitter end; Joe's hard-yarding style sends the rigging crew running for cover; two new teams of ox loggers enter the race.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank discover a fleet of amazing concept cars, some so unique they don't know how to price them.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank find a 65-million year-old dinosaur bone; a 60s Bella German scooter; an antique audio recording device made from piano wire.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Terry's staggering scrap yard; coin-op kings Gary and John; Frank takes a gamble on some old school peep show machines; Steve and Tom open up their massive collection of toy cars and trucks; Danielle gets an appraisal on the peep show item.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys pick an Appalachian village museum; Danielle is unimpressed with the pool candidates she's met to manage the new store; a father and son duo open the doors to their staggering collection.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers are back in Gardena, CA and Dave Hester's rival Nabila Hannis is back as well. Jarrod and Brandi get in the game by grabbing a sportsman's locker. Darrell drops seven grand on a unit full of construction equipment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers are back in Santa Ana, CA with one notable exception, Jarrod Schulz.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers are in "Tinseltown Adjacent", otherwise known as North Hollywood, CA. But first it's the grand re-opening of Jarrod and Brandi's store.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers do battle in Rancho Cucamonga, CA. Dave Hester arrives in a truck big enough to fit his ego AND a massive house hold unit. Darrell and Brandon try to get back on track. Jarrod and Brandi find a vintage mask.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers make a pilgrimage to the desert of Lancaster, CA. West side heavy hitter Nabila Haniss makes the trek and is richly rewarded. Dave Hester brings the fifth wheel and ends up feeling like one.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head west, to Inglewood, CA. It's Nabila Haniss's neck of the woods, but what she finds could end up shooting blanks. Darrell Sheets's bravado is on display, and not much else.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The Dotson's follow the money to Santa Cruz, CA and the buyers follow the Dotsons...right into a torrential rainstorm. Dave Hester finds some quilts to help keep dry and patch together a profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers stay up north and invade "the city by the bay"... San Francisco, CA. Barry finds an apprentice and an old pair of boxers. Jarrod and Brandi uncover something top secret.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head for the high desert in Highland, CA. Darrell buys on a hunch, and finds something that gets him out of the danger zone. Dave Hester never gets his money out of his man bag.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The third season begins at the crack of dawn in La Verne, CA, and finds "The Collector" in training. Dave Hester enjoys bidding, and bidding people up.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers venture back to the notorious vault auction, this time in Chattsworth, CA. Jarrod and Brandi find something that makes noise, if not money.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to the northern part of Southern California, Oxnard. Barry Weiss finds a room with a view. Dave Hester's looking for gold, and finds bronze.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Buying erupts in Hawaiian Gardens, CA. Barry decides to start thinking inside the box, and brings and inside man.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers descend upon Laguna Nigel, CA. Jarrod and Brandi look to fill their shelves, and their pockets.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si recruits his nephews to help him transport a storage container to his backyard, but things take a turn when Jep becomes locked inside the box.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and the guys take John Luke golfing prior to his engagement party, their attempts at marital advice don't exactly work out as planned.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase receives a palate of fireworks as a gift, he and the guys create a homemade fireworks display for the Robertson family 4th of July barbeque. Meanwhile, Uncle Si is honored by the veterans association and given his own exhibit at a local military museum.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil and Jase get into an argument about which type of duck decoy works best, Jase and the guys repaint some old decoys, betting that Phil cannot tell the difference. Meanwhile, Jessica challenges Willie to a bowling contest with Kay's "Big Sista's" club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys discover they have a knack for removing pests from other people's property, they use their new talents to their advantage. Meanwhile, Willie gives Sadie and John Luke summer jobs at his diner, but first he must train them to be good employees.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When an office prank war spirals out of control, Phil volunteers Willie, Jase, and Jep to help Alan at the church, which seems more like a punishment than charity work. Meanwhile, Korie gives Kay a surprise art class taught by famous artist Pierre Matisse.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the guys spend the weekend at a hunting cabin to celebrate Martin's bachelor party, things turns explosive after they find a cache of antique black powder weapons. Meanwhile, Willie helps Kay fulfill her lifelong dream of owning a petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Uncle Si has a brush with death, he creates a bucket list and asks the guys to help him fulfill his dreams. Meanwhile, Kay sets out to prove to Willie and Alan that she actually graduated high school.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Duck Commander sponsors a NASCAR race, Jase and the guys get themselves in the mood by attempting to work as a pit crew. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie challenge John Luke and his fianc Mary Kate to a doubles tennis match.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: In this very special wedding episode, John Luke Robertson is getting married to his fianc Mary Kate, and our cameras are with him every step of the way.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Missy's parents visit, her father convinces Jase to take him on a quail hunt. But while their "bonding hunt" yields very few quail, it does bring them closer together as friends.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie's old rival Phillip McMillan challenges him to a game of dodgeball, Willie recruits his family members to settle a score once and for all.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and Phil make a bet about whether or not human beings in a duck blind are visible from the air, Jep buys a drone copter to get a "bird's eye" view, but ends up losing it in the process.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and the guys convince Willie to hire his older brother Alan to work at Duck Commander, but when Alan begins micromanaging everyone, they quickly change their mind.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertsons throw a Renaissance Fair birthday party for Godwin, various family members compete in a tournament to win knighthood.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: In this special episode, the Duck Commander team surprises two wounded veterans with a trip to Monroe so they can be in an episode of Duck Dynasty. To show their support, the Robertson family stages a "color run" to bring awareness to our wounded soldiers.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Alan agree to help Miss Kay open her own bakery, but things take a turn when it Kay is asked to hand over her secret recipes.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Missy and Jase's son Reed purchases an old van to boost his music career, his parents begin to question some of his choices.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and his brothers spend too much time frog hunting, their wives challenge them to a "frogging" competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family takes a road trip to Liberty University where they will drop off John Luke and Mary Kate for their first year of college. Along the way, they stop in Nashville to visit Willie's friend Colt Ford.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family throws a party for Willie & Korie's 25th anniversary, but things take a dramatic turn when Willie and Korie reveal a big secret. Meanwhile, when Jase blames Uncle Si for getting him a parking ticket.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie asks a local chainsaw artist to make him a statue, he gets a big surprise when it's revealed that the statue is of an unlikely subject -- Willie himself. Meanwhile, Jep and Jessica attempt to help Kay with her hoarding.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Other than bringing criminals to justice, one of Dog's loves is teaching the next generation of bounty hunters the tricks of the trade. Today he has a new student.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has problems when he goes to a small town on the Big Island of Hawaii to track down a fugitive. In a small town, everyone knows everyone else's business, making it impossible for Dog to hunt in secret.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team really have their hands full when they go after a tough guy named Nunu, who leads them on a chase through apartment complexes and a shopping mall before he's finally captured. But Dog is charmed by Nunu's unquenchable

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team go after Kandice, AKA Candy, AKA Suga, a stripper who didn't make her court appearance. They convince one of her friends to lure her to a supermarket parking lot, where Dog has an easy time fetching the fetching young thing.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog finds himself fighting two enemies--the law and his inner demons. He continues his legal battle to fight extradition to Mexico in connection with his 2003 capture of fugitive rapist Andrew Luster. His other struggle is private.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and his team return to their roots, with a visit to their home town of Denver, Colorado. Dog and Tim begin the day with an early morning radio show appearance, and it pays off.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog shows his love of justice and children in this poignant episode. He begins by giving encouragement to a group of handicapped children and making them honorary members of his posse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Leland and Dog make a quick visit to the police supply store to get some new gadgets for the team. But they can't linger because they've also got a fugitive to catch. Their target is reputed to have an explosive temper.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There are few louder wake-up calls than coming-to in a jail cell with no idea how you got there. Add the media splashing the news of your arrest on every TV channel, and if your name is Lyssa Chapman you know you are in for a rough day.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This hunt is personal. Dog's good friend and fellow bondsman Chris is running out of time. He has only days to find his fugitive or risk losing his business. In his hunt Dog confronts duplicitous tipsters, vicious attack dogs, and hostile neighbors.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog finds himself fighting two enemies--the law and his inner demons. He continues his legal battle to fight extradition to Mexico in connection with his 2003 capture of fugitive rapist Andrew Luster. His other struggle is private.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog shows his love of justice and children in this poignant episode. He begins by giving encouragement to a group of handicapped children and making them honorary members of his posse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Leland and Dog make a quick visit to the police supply store to get some new gadgets for the team. But they can't linger because they've also got a fugitive to catch. Their target is reputed to have an explosive temper.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There are few louder wake-up calls than coming-to in a jail cell with no idea how you got there. Add the media splashing the news of your arrest on every TV channel, and if your name is Lyssa Chapman you know you are in for a rough day.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog leads the team on another adrenaline-filled chase in Denver. The fugitive, Robert, has a habit of address-hopping that makes him a difficult target, but Dog refuses to give up and finally tracks Robert down in his latest hideaway.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: They say you can't teach an old dog new tricks, but what if it's The Dog doing the teaching? Today's target is wanted on domestic abuse charges, but when Dog discovers she works for an escort service he opts for a new twist on an old ruse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog finds himself looking for more than one fugitive. He starts the day looking for a woman who has skipped out on her court date.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What's a father to do? When the cops ask Dog for help tracking down a renegade teen with a history of running hard, Baby Lyssa, eight months pregnant and counting, insists on joins the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
